Class ViewData

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.model.ViewData
public final class ViewData extends Object
A data class that encapsulates all information required by the view layer to render the game state. This includes the current brick's data, its position, next bricks, ghost brick position, and held brick.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    ViewData(int[][] brickData, int xPosition, int yPosition, int[][][] nextBricksData, int ghostXPosition, int ghostYPosition, int[][] heldBrickData)
    Constructs a new ViewData object with support for multiple next brick previews and a held brick.
    ViewData(int[][] brickData, int xPosition, int yPosition, int[][] nextBrickData, int ghostXPosition, int ghostYPosition)
    Constructs a new ViewData object using a single next brick preview (legacy constructor).

  • Constructor Details

    • ViewData

      public ViewData(int[][] brickData, int xPosition, int yPosition, int[][] nextBrickData, int ghostXPosition, int ghostYPosition)
      Constructs a new ViewData object using a single next brick preview (legacy constructor).
      Parameters:
      brickData - The 2D array of the current active brick's shape.
      xPosition - The x-coordinate of the current active brick.
      yPosition - The y-coordinate of the current active brick.
      nextBrickData - The 2D array of the next brick's shape.
      ghostXPosition - The x-coordinate of the ghost brick.
      ghostYPosition - The y-coordinate of the ghost brick.

    • ViewData

      public ViewData(int[][] brickData, int xPosition, int yPosition, int[][][] nextBricksData, int ghostXPosition, int ghostYPosition, int[][] heldBrickData)
      Constructs a new ViewData object with support for multiple next brick previews and a held brick.
      Parameters:
      brickData - The 2D array of the current active brick's shape.
      xPosition - The x-coordinate of the current active brick.
      yPosition - The y-coordinate of the current active brick.
      nextBricksData - A 3D array where each 2D array is the shape of an upcoming brick.
      ghostXPosition - The x-coordinate of the ghost brick.
      ghostYPosition - The y-coordinate of the ghost brick.
      heldBrickData - The 2D array of the held brick's shape, or null if no brick is held.

  • Method Details

    • getBrickData

      public int[][] getBrickData()
      Returns a deep copy of the 2D integer array representing the current active brick's shape.
      Returns:
      A deep copy of the brick data.

    • getxPosition

      public int getxPosition()
      Returns the x-coordinate (column) of the current active brick's top-left corner.
      Returns:
      The x-coordinate.

    • getyPosition

      public int getyPosition()
      Returns the y-coordinate (row) of the current active brick's top-left corner.
      Returns:
      The y-coordinate.

    • getGhostXPosition

      public int getGhostXPosition()
      Returns the x-coordinate (column) of the ghost brick's top-left corner.
      Returns:
      The x-coordinate of the ghost brick.

    • getGhostYPosition

      public int getGhostYPosition()
      Returns the y-coordinate (row) of the ghost brick's top-left corner.
      Returns:
      The y-coordinate of the ghost brick.

    • getNextBrickData

      public int[][] getNextBrickData()
      Returns a deep copy of the 2D integer array representing the next brick's shape (legacy).
      Returns:
      A deep copy of the next brick data.

    • getNextBricksData

      public int[][][] getNextBricksData()
      Returns a deep copy of the 3D integer array representing the upcoming bricks' shapes.
      Returns:
      A deep copy of the next bricks data.

    • getHeldBrickData

      public int[][] getHeldBrickData()
      Returns a deep copy of the 2D integer array representing the held brick's shape.
      Returns:
      A deep copy of the held brick data, or an empty 2D array if no brick is held.
